column5: http://www.thestar.com/news/article/893360--monster-leaf-sets-a-world-record  I know, I know. Someone knows a guy who caught a bigger one
I read that earlier today, congrats to the kid and screw the kids bugging him about it.  G
Heard this story tonight while tuned in to CBC radio. It's a feel good thing ...really.
If you read the article you'll realize that it's a simple case of nuclear mutation.. the kid found it in Pickering!  Cool story!

About sums it up. Young Norway Maples or sucker growth will produce a few extremely large leaves until they mature a little. My kids always had one extremely large specimen in the middle of their annual fall leaf collections for school.
That tree should be tested for steroids.
That one hasn't won a cup in over 40 yrs either....
That's some good stuff right there!  Clarence
Congrats to Joseph Donato ! That's one heck of a maple leaf.
